data.title: Twice in one day!
data.text: We loved our lunch and retuned for dinner! Close to our hotel, food was delicious, great value. Service also excellent, very relaxed. Small place but fast service so if busy the wait shouldn't be long.

data.title: Mmmm... really great pizza and tapas
data.text: The pizzas are big enough for two people to share and they are delicious. We also ordered several small plates as well which were also very tasty.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: We were looking for a great casual place to eat after a day of site-seeing and the Jack-o-Lantern Spectacular and were enticed by the aroma from the wood-fire grill.  We tried nearly all the grill items (small-plates) and thoroughly enjoyed the meal and atmosphere -  would certainly return!

data.title: A must do when in town
data.text: We extended the patio di ing season a few weeks thanks to the outdoor heaters at this fine restaurant.  Everything is cooked over open fire or in their brick oven for a nice smoky taste.  If you cant get in here go next door to the Red Fin Crudo which is also excellent.

data.title: Amazing food with great staff!
data.text: My family and I dined at Figidini our very first night in providence. It was recommended to us by our hotel front desk. We were so beyond pleased we were tempted to go there every night but we really wanted to explore the city. We had delicious olives for an appetizer. We also shared an order of perfectly cooked scallops. As far as an entree we shared perfectly cooked thin crust pizzas that were absolutely delicious. Beyond the food our waitress Katelyn was super friendly and helpful with many recommendations since it was out first visit. I highly recommend Figidini and I will be returning if I go back to Providence!

data.title: yum
data.text:
delicious food, waitress Kaitlyn was fantastic - loved her - 
 eclectic little place - loved it - everyones plates of food looked very     good!  highly recommend -

data.title: Terrific wood-fired pizza. Daily wine specials too!
data.text: Delicious!  I had a Margharita "wet" style pizza.  Juicy, fresh, not too much cheese, and the shaved garlic made the difference.  So very good. A local referred me to the restaurant and it did not disappoint. I wish I knew the name of the red wine that was on special. It was light, fruit forward and complemented the figs and pizza very well.  The grilled figs were tasty but average, hence the four stars.  The waitress was fun, steered me right.  The bartender was friendly and checked in with and chatted even though I was seated at a table.  Very friendly, nice atmosphere and clean.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Small plates are literally small. Really felt like I got ripped off. The desert was nothing but sponge cake with hints of lemon cream when it was supposed to be "cheesecake". Left there hungry! The only good part of the evening was the cocktail. Can't believe they are still open. Actually, I know why.. the are very profitable...serving such little portions.

data.title: Naples,Italy in Providence
data.text: Figidini please do not change anything,your food, especially the divine pizza you serve would make the best( Napolitano pizzaiolo )blush with envy, it is perfect,your servers go out of their way to make you feel at home just like a (Napolitana osteria) keep up the Napolitana pizza tradition.

data.title: The worst soggy pizza
data.text: They had the right idea but the crust and bottom of the pizza was wet and ruined the taste. There is no excuse for such pizza in providence.

data.title: Naples pizza
data.text: My wife and I were headed to Boston for the weekend and decided to take a break in Providence to stretch and get lunch. We saw Figidini, the restaurant looked great, plus wood fire pizza was a attention grabber.  We sat at the bar, the bartender, she was super friendly and a breath of sunshine. She explained the Naples style pizza, I had served in the Navy and went to Naples, the pizza is an acquired taste.  My wife is Italian from Brooklyn, so she knows her pizza, she didn't like it, I told her this is the way they do it in Naples.  If you like Naples style pizza then this place is for you, because it is authentic!

data.title: Amazing food, great atmosphere
data.text: We stepped in out of the rain and thought we were in Italy.  Great experience, not your typical american Italian experience.  We had a dish of olives and wine in short glasses.  Then some amazing scallops.  Moved onto real margarita pizza with the coal crust.  Highly recommend.  We'll be back whenever we are in Providence.

data.title: An interesting experience
data.text:
The pizza is excellent with some unique flavor combinations, but not cheap.  My four slice speciality  personal pizza was $18.

The experience was unique.  A very busy lunchtime and somehow our order must have been misplaced.  After 30 minutes, we asked how much longer; the waitress told it would be soon.  10 minutes later saw the three women sitting at the bar receive their order; they were seated after our order was taking by the waitress.  So checked with waitress again - she went to the chef and came back to tell us 5 more minutes.

We waited another 20 minutes and saw another group, who were seated after our order had been taken, receive their pizza.  Nearly an hour had passed,  we told the waitress to cancel the order and refund the payment. (The service was so slow, I paid by credit card before receiving the order so that we wouldn't be delayed returning to our meeting).

She went back to the chef and I could see they were both upset. (It turned out the chef is the owner).  She came back and said the pizza was about to go in.  At this point we were out of time and patience.  I walked back with her to be clear to the chef we did not want the pizza and wanted a refund.  He had just laid out the dough for our two pizzas. 

I was amazed at his anger over a basic request to cancel an order for a two pizzas that had not been made and my request for refund. A very basic request when food orders are delayed this much.

Also not pleased by one of his "sous chefs" who decided to walk up to me and "stop being rude".  I ignored him, with no comment at all.

My colleague and I left the restaurant to try to find a quick takeout to return to our meeting.  The owner, to his credit, ran down the street to give us the two pizzas we had ordered - he did so without payment. 

The pizza was excellent,  his ultimate response was what I would expect,  or at least some version like a significant discount.  I hope he and his staff can fix the order snafu - his food is very good.

data.title: Favorite.
data.text: In a city filled with really great restaurants this is a standout.  Atmosphere is relaxed and chill, great music, outstanding cocktails and the food, ah.  We've tried everything and are constantly amazed at the clever dishes the chef puts together.  Of course, the pizza -Margarita extra is our favorite, a classic but there is so much to love. Oh, don't forget dessert, ridiculously amazing.

data.title: Fun
data.text:
A unique, little tapas pizza restaurant in Providence serves up big flavor. The restaurant is hip, the service is great and the food is yummy. I'm not a fan of small plates restaurants, but Figidini gives you fair prices and decent portions for the amounts unlike other "shared plates" restaurants (Persimmon). 

We started with the figs and a salad which were delicious. The margherita pizza was yummy, although could have used more pizza sauce. The pear martini was good, but a tad small. 

Definitely a fun restaurant to visit and look forward to returning.

data.title: Excellent, easy little restaurant
data.text: Figidini has "the good smell" - wood smoke and garlic.  Swoon!  Their pizza is fabulous - in fact I've never had anything less than perfect food.  Simple - tapas, small pizzas, maybe a few special mains per night.  Love love love.  My only reason for giving a "very good" instead of "excellent" review is that I find one of the bartenders to be a little snooty and uninterested in her customers - look, love, the place isn't that big - you have time for a friendly word.

data.title: Great small plates
data.text: Have eaten at the other wood fire pizza place and decided to try this one since we're big pizza fans. Were pleasantly surprised to find such a variety of food!  My dinner companion stuck with the small plates--kind of like tapas. I stuck with the cheese pizza--so good with the buffalo cheese! Can get a little loud in here when crowded. Good food.

data.title: Great inventive food
data.text: The food is wonderful and inventive.  We came here for the pizza, but the small plates and dessert were the highlights.  We had a fig and proscuito appetizer which was delicious as was the calamari.  The dessert was difficult to describe.  Very unusual with lemon curd, orange cake, earl tea pudding and several other touches.  Delicious.  We had the margarita pizza with buffalo mozzarella.  Excellent ingredients but the pie was soggy in the middle.  I believe this is the Neopolitan style but I prefer a crispy crust.  The service was top notch.  It was hot out and we were thirsty and asked for a glass of ice to add to our water.  To our surprise, during the meal our waitress refilled our ice glass with fresh ice.  Overall, a great dining experience.  The historic downtown is an interesting place to stroll around.

data.title: Soggy pizza, don't bother!
data.text: I can't believe this place has high reviews.  The atmosphere and location are great, I'll give it that.  Staff is also friendly so they've got that going from them.  The pizza is horrendous!  It was so doughy that it was almost like it was not cooked.  Maybe I'm a pizza snob being from the New Haven area but this just didn't do it for me, like the worst I've ever had!  Pricey too!!! $70 for 2 small pizzas and a salad.  A waste of calories and money!

owner_response.author: Figidini, Owner at Figidini Wood Fire Eatery, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello J3944,

Neapolitan pizza is like no other style of pizza.  Your description was not a mistake because Neapolitan pizza is known for being a "wet/soggy" pie.  I've attached a link that describes what to expect when visiting a Neapolitan pizzeria.  You mentioned you are from New Haven which leads me to believe you are familiar with Coal Fired pizza which is a totally different beast.  As for our ingredients EVERYTHING is either imported from Italy and/or Spain to make our pie.  The mozzarella di Bufala which is on our Margherita extra comes from the Water Buffalo (imported from Campania).  It contains much more moisture than regular mozzarella so combined with the crushed DOP San Marzano tomatoes it creates a pizza that needs to be eaten with a knife and fork.  Our flour, Caputo 00, is also imported from Italy and is milled twice.  This dough is very different from American style because there is NO sugar and oil added to it making it much lighter.  Many of our regulars and/or visitors that have traveled to Naples, Italy tell us all the time that we have created a pizza that reflects complete authenticity to what you would find in Naples.  This may be the reason for us having so many great reviews.  We are a small independent restaurant that is completely dedicated to providing our customers with a lovely dining experience but mostly to showcase the product that we love the most, Neapolitan pizza.  Everyone is entitled to their opinions on what style of pizza they like the best and certainly it seems that this style isn't for your liking but I wanted you to know that what you were served was not a mistake just a different style that you are not used to.  We hope this message finds you well.   http://slice.seriouseats.com/archives/2011/08/what-to-expect-at-a-neapolitan-pizzeria.html
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Service, Ok Food, Good Vibe
data.text: Came in with my two kids for a quick bite to eat.  My daughter loves pizza and thought she would enjoy it.  She didn't think the pizza was good.  It was too floppy for her taste and my son wouldn't even try it, but he is super picky.  I got a couple of the tapas and they were yummy, the saganaki cheese was good ( bit salty) but very tasty and so was the steak.  Waiter never asked how I wanted it prepared and it came out rare.  So I sent it back and he had it cooked medium for me.  Very small menu with not a lot of options.  The atmosphere was really nice and lots of beverage options at the bar.  Nice spot just not right for my family and I.
